doc.after: Although van der Weyden did not title the work, and the sitter's name is not recorded in any of the early inventories,[28] the style of her dress has been used to place the picture very late in van der Weyden's career. The c.Â 1460 dating is based on the high-fashion dress and the work's apparent chronological position in the evolution of van der Weyden's style.[29] However, it is possible that it was executed even later (van der Weyden died in 1464).[11]
